Description: Base sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos-stand, part of the upper surface and torus moulding at its edge; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of animal (fired mainly red-brown) with added red between ribs and part of another animal, possibly a hare with red on belly, running to right underneath, perhaps looking back.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.570.e, 1888,0601.570.f, 1888,0601.570.h and 1965,0930.807.
Bibliographic references: Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13-6, fig. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0267) (Phase 1)
